register.description: Scheduler Control Register

bitfield.description: scheduler enable; write '1' to enable scheduler
Pipeline Number of HWA0 Scheduler
'1' -> Streaming input enable, '0' No streaming input
'1' -> pause/suspend scheduler , '0' -> resume scheduler
Current state of HWA0 Scheduler
'0' -> HWA0 Scheduler resources must not be read during halted state. '1'-> HWA0 Scheduler resources are readable during halted state

register.description: Scheduler HOP Control Register. Help in detecting eop within scheduler. Once configured, it counts task/channel starts and stops issuing further start. Specifically useful for Head of pipe dma scheduler .

bitfield.description: '1' -> Head of Pipe producer Sch , '0' -> No hop
Number of Task count for Head of pipe

register.description: Watchdog timer control register

bitfield.description: '1' -> activate watchdog timer for 64K VPAC/DMPAC cycles between task start and task done '0' -> Disable watchdog timer
HWA0 Scheduler watchdog timer status '1' -> Timer Active '0' -> Timer Inactive (count is stable)
Watchdog timeout count '1' -> 128K , '0' -> 64K
Current value of HWA0 Scheduler watchdog timer count

register.description: Scheduler BW Control Register. Processing unit level BW control. Use DMA to eliminate peak system BW within processing units line/Block

bitfield.description: '1' -> Enable BW limiter function for HWA0 sch, '0' --> Disable
Max Token count to create average BW
Average Cycle count between successive Task Start

register.description: control register to manage pattern adapter on HWA0 prod socket0

bitfield.description: '1' -> pa enable, '0' -> disable
'1' -> post pattern adaptation, decrement ps count by count_dec , '0' -> post pattern adaptation, decrement ps count by pa_cs_maxcount

'1' -> Apply threshold, count_preload and count_postload on pattern adapter count (use this only when pa_enable='1') '0' -> Apply threshold, count_preload and count_postload on prod count (same behavior as if no pattern adapter. destination count for pattern adaptation (N), M --> N

register.description: Scheduler Control Register

bitfield.description: scheduler enable; write '1' to enable scheduler
Pipeline Number of HWA2 Scheduler
'1' -> Streaming input enable, '0' No streaming input
'1' -> pause/suspend scheduler , '0' -> resume scheduler
Current state of HWA2 Scheduler
'0' -> HWA2 Scheduler resources must not be read during halted state. '1'-> HWA2 Scheduler resources are readable during halted state
'1' -> LDC REGION/sub-frame feature enabled, '0' LDC works in Frame mode only

register.description: Scheduler HOP Control Register. Help in detecting eop within scheduler. Once configured, it counts task/channel starts and stops issuing further starts. Specifically useful for Head of pipe dma scheduler .

bitfield.description: '1' -> activate watchdog timer for 64K VPAC/DMPAC cycles between task start and task done '0' -> Disable watchdog timer
HWA2 Scheduler watchdog timer status '1' -> Timer Active '0' -> Timer Inactive (count is stable)
Watchdog timeout count '1' -> 128K , '0' -> 64K
Current value of HWA2 Scheduler watchdog timer count

register.description: Scheduler BW Control Register. Processing unit level BW control. Use DMA to eliminate peak system BW within processing units line/Block

bitfield.description: '1' -> Enable BW limiter function for HWA2 sch, '0' --> Disable
Max Token count to create average BW

register.description: Controlling producer socket0 for HWA2

bitfield.description: '1' -> Producer socket 0 enable , '0' Disable
consumer select for HWA2 prod socket 0. Used in decrementing count of producer buffer
Remaining block count to complete configured BPR at End of Row or End of Region Row when LDC is configured in tdone_gen_mode='0'

0: Normal behavior; 1 : Prod Socket 0 is used to trigger DMA channel to transfer end of Row or End of Region Row buffer data for prod socket (0+2)%4. Useful when this Buffer is not completely filled at end of row and it enables triggering separate DMA channel for end of row. Rely on tdone_bpr_early attribute; 2: Prod Socket 0 is used to trigger DMA channel to transfer end of Row or End of Region Row buffer data for prod socket (0+2)%4. Useful when this Buffer is not completely filled at end of row and it enables triggering separate DMA channel for end of row. Rely on end of Row attribute. Must not be used in dual output mode

register.description: Scheduler Control Register

bitfield.description: scheduler enable; write '1' to enable scheduler
Pipeline Number of HWA3 Scheduler
'1' -> Streaming input enable, '0' No streaming input
'1' -> pause/suspend scheduler , '0' -> resume scheduler
Current state of HWA3 Scheduler
'0' -> HWA3 Scheduler resources must not be read during halted state. '1'-> HWA3 Scheduler resources are readable during halted state
'1' -> LDC REGION/sub-frame feature enabled, '0' LDC works in Frame mode only

register.description: Scheduler HOP Control Register. Help in detecting eop within scheduler. Once configured, it counts task/channel starts and stops issuing further starts. Specifically useful for Head of pipe dma scheduler .

bitfield.description: '1' -> Head of Pipe producer Sch , '0' -> No hop
Number of Task count for Head of pipe

register.description: Watchdog timer control register

bitfield.description: '1' -> activate watchdog timer for 64K VPAC/DMPAC cycles between task start and task done '0' -> Disable watchdog timer
HWA3 Scheduler watchdog timer status '1' -> Timer Active '0' -> Timer Inactive (count is stable)
Watchdog timeout count '1' -> 128K , '0' -> 64K
Current value of HWA3 Scheduler watchdog timer count

register.description: Scheduler BW Control Register. Processing unit level BW control. Use DMA to eliminate peak system BW within processing units line/Block

bitfield.description: '1' -> Enable BW limiter function for HWA3 sch, '0' --> Disable
Max Token count to create average BW
Average Cycle count between successive Task Start

register.description: Controlling producer socket0 for HWA3

bitfield.description: '1' -> Producer socket 0 enable , '0' Disable
consumer select for HWA3 prod socket 0. Used in decrementing count of producer buffer
Remaining block count to complete configured BPR at End of Row or End of Region Row when LDC is configured in tdone_gen_mode='0'

0: Normal behavior; 1 : Prod Socket 0 is used to trigger DMA channel to transfer end of Row or End of Region Row buffer data for prod socket (0+2)%4. Useful when this Buffer is not completely filled at end of row and it enables triggering separate DMA channel for end of row. Rely on tdone_bpr_early attribute; 2: Prod Socket 0 is used to trigger DMA channel to transfer end of Row or End of Region Row buffer data for prod socket (0+2)%4. Useful when this Buffer is not completely filled at end of row and it enables triggering separate DMA channel for end of row. Rely on end of Row attribute. Must not be used in dual output mode

bitfield.description: '1' -> pa enable, '0' -> disable

'1' -> Apply threshold, count_preload and count_postload on pattern adapter count (use this only when pa_enable='1') '0' -> Apply threshold, count_preload and count_postload on prod count (same behavior as if no pattern adapter. destination count for pattern adaptation (N), M --> N

register.description: Pipeline Debug Control register is used by debug software to control pipeline debug behavior

bitfield.description: '1' -> Pipeline0 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline0 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline1 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline1 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline2 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline2 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline3 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline3 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline4 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline4 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline5 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline5 respond to debug events
'1' -> Pipeline6 doesn't respond to debug events, '0' Pipeline5 respond to debug events
'1' -> Abort Debug activity on debug enabled pipelines, '0' no impact
Current state of Debug activity

register.description: Debug Capability register is used by debug software to determine which optional debug modules are present and how many instances of each module exist.

bitfield.description: Minor Revision
Major Revision
The number of breakpoint modules that exist. The registers supporting the breakpoint modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map.
The number of watchpoint modules that exist. The registers supporting the watchpoint modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map
The number of counter modules that exist. The registers supporting the counter modules must be implemented consecutively in the memory map.
Number of Trigger Channels Supported. b00 ------ No channels supported. b01 ------ One channel supported. b10 ------ Two channels supported. Others ---- Reserved.
b0 - Trigger Inputs are not supported. b1 - Trigger Inputs are supported.
b0 - Trigger Outputs are not supported. b1 - Trigger Outputs are supported.
Whether HWA Core Execution status and control is supported. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.
Whether HWA Core reset is supported or not which does not affect debug logic. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.
Whether HWA Core supports SWBP or not. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Supported.
Indicates if the HWA supports an indirect memory access port. v2.0 and above. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Indirect port supported.
Indicates if the HWA supports an module ownership. v2.0 and above. b0 - Not Supported. b1 - Ownership supported.
Indicates if the WP resources has corresponding data qualification. b0 - Not supported. b1 - Data qualifiers are supported.
Indicates that debug execution control can determine if single step blocks or allows interrupts. b0 No step/interrupt control b1 Step interrupt control via DBG_INT_STEP_IN

register.description: Debug Control register is used by debug software to control all of the basic debug functions.

bitfield.description: Global debug run control. The bit will be read as being set upon entry to HALTED state due to halted state being entered because of SWBP, HWBP, HWWP, EMU0 / 1 trigger or manual halt requested through this control. Writing '1' when read '0' shall cause a halt on the next possible halt boundary.Writing '0' when read '1' returns the system to the natural execution state.A synchronous run hardware request has the same effect.Reading '1' means that the halted state has been reached or been requested by the manual halt mechanism.Reading '0' means that the target is in its natural execution state.NOTE: 1. The natural execution state means the FSM state entered prior to last entry into Halted state. 2. This would be the last application requested FSM state unless the DBG_SYS_EXE_REQ control was used to change it.

Debug Restart Status bit.This bit is normally set when the DBG_HALT bit transitions from '1' to '0' when the natural execution state is entered.It is a sticky bit. It may also be set when a synchronous run causes the accelerator to leave halted state. Reading '1' means HWA Core exited halted state (at least temporarily). Reading '0' means HWA Core did not exit halted state. Writing '1' shall clear the bit if set. There is no restriction on when it can be cleared. Writing '0' shall have no effect.

Single Step Execution enable. When this bit is set, the accelerator core shall be halted upon execution of a single instruction. This is after the accelerator core has left the halted state by clearing the DBG_HALT control bit. Writing '1' enables halting when the next instruction following exit from halted state is executed. Writing '0' disables halts via single step. NOTE: 1. When the accelerator core enters its natural execution state, it may or may not execute an instruction and re-enter HALTED state.
EMU0 input trigger enable Writing '1' enables halting on the falling edge of the EMU0 input Writing '0' disables halts via EMU0 input
The execution status of the module Set to '1' when halted due to debug event Set to '0' when execution resumes
Execution halted due to single step completion Set to '1' when the single step completes Set to '0' when execution resumes
Execution halted due to register update of DBG_HALT Set to '1' when halt due to DBG_HALT update completes Set to '0' when execution resumes
Execution halted due to trigger in on EMU0 input Set to '1' when halt due to EMU0 input completes Set to '0' when execution resumes

EMU0 output control. The cross trigger output control. The value in this field determines the behavior of the outputs generated on EMU0. NOTE: The effect of setting any non-zero value is ignored if the HWA Core is currently in HALTED state until the HWA core exits and re-enters HALTED state. DBG_EMUn_CNTL Output Enable Output Pulse Description 0 De-asserted 0 NA No output. Input only 1 Stopping 0 Yes Pulse on halt. If this bit is set when halted then no effect until the HWA re-enters halted state. 2 HWBP 0 Yes Pulse when any HWBP triggers 3 HWWP 0 Yes Pulse when any HWWP triggers 4 Asserted 1 No Drive pin high 5 Asserted 0 No Drive pin low 6-15 - - Reserved
Sticky status bit to reflect reset has been generated
